snippet: Oscar Ibarra, who entered the shelter system with his mother and several siblings, is the first member of his family to attend college.
abstract: Brooklyn Community Services, one of agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, secures $320 to pay for Oscar Ibarra to take his school's senior trip; Ibarra, who spent months in New York City's shelter system with his mother and several siblings, is first member of his family to attend college.
lead_paragraph: Oscar Ibarra, who entered the shelter system with his mother and several siblings, is the first member of his family to attend college.

headline.main: Two Months in a Homeless Shelter Spurred a Teenager’s Desire to Study
headline.print_headline: Two Months in a Homeless Shelter Spurred a Teenager’s Desire to Study
